TEXT.English: "The glorious sun stays in its course and plays the alchemist. Turning with splendour of his precious eye the meagre earth to glittering gold." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Chinese: "The glorious sun stays in its course and plays the alchemist. Turning with splendour of his precious eye the meagre earth to glittering gold." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: "We reveal this Book unto thee as an exposition of all things, and a guidance and a mercy to those of you who submit to Allah" - Muhammad, Sura 16.90
TEXT.Chinese: "We reveal this Book unto thee as an exposition of all things, and a guidance and a mercy to those of you who submit to Allah" - Muhammad, Sura 16.90

TEXT.English: "There is no disease that Allah has created, except that He also has created its treatment." - Sunan Abi Dawood
TEXT.Chinese: "There is no disease that Allah has created, except that He also has created its treatment." - Sunan Abi Dawood

TEXT.English: "It is from their foes, not from their friends, that cities learn the wisdom of building high walls." - Aristophanes
TEXT.Chinese: "It is from their foes, not from their friends, that cities learn the wisdom of building high walls." - Aristophanes

TEXT.English: "There is nothing which wounds the heart of a noble man more than the thought of his honour being assailed." - Moliere
TEXT.Chinese: "There is nothing which wounds the heart of a noble man more than the thought of his honour being assailed." - Moliere

TEXT.English: "All things are in the Universe, and the Universe in all things; we in it and it in us; in this way everything in perfect unity." - Giordano Bruno
TEXT.Chinese: "All things are in the Universe, and the Universe in all things; we in it and it in us; in this way everything in perfect unity." - Giordano Bruno

TEXT.English: "Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another." - Plato
TEXT.Chinese: "Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another." - Plato

TEXT.English: "Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies." - Thomas Jefferson
TEXT.Chinese: "Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies." - Thomas Jefferson

TEXT.English: "In all things of Nature, there is something of the marvellous." - Aristotle
TEXT.Chinese: "In all things of Nature, there is something of the marvellous." - Aristotle

TEXT.English: "And them that take up the sword shall perish by the sword" - Book of Matthew, the Bible
TEXT.Chinese: "And them that take up the sword shall perish by the sword" - Book of Matthew, the Bible

TEXT.English: "It is entirely seemly for a young man killed in battle to lie mangled by the bronze spear. In his death all things appear fair." - Homer
TEXT.Chinese: "It is entirely seemly for a young man killed in battle to lie mangled by the bronze spear. In his death all things appear fair." - Homer

TEXT.English: "For everything there is a season and a time for every purpose under heaven." - Ecclisiastics, The Bible
TEXT.Chinese: "For everything there is a season and a time for every purpose under heaven." - Ecclisiastics, The Bible

TEXT.English: "The glories of our blood and state are shadows not substantial things. There is no armour against fate. Death lays his icy hand on kings." - James Shirley
TEXT.Chinese: "The glories of our blood and state are shadows not substantial things. There is no armour against fate. Death lays his icy hand on kings." - James Shirley

TEXT.English: "We must trust to nothing but facts. These are presented to us by Nature and cannot deceive. We ought in every instance to submit our reasoning to the test of experiment and observation." - Antoine Lavoissier
TEXT.Chinese: "We must trust to nothing but facts. These are presented to us by Nature and cannot deceive. We ought in every instance to submit our reasoning to the test of experiment and observation." - Antoine Lavoissier

TEXT.English: "He was a verrey purfit, gentil knight." - Geoffrey Chaucer
TEXT.Chinese: "He was a verrey purfit, gentil knight." - Geoffrey Chaucer

TEXT.English: "Building well has three conditions; firmness, commodity and delight." - Vitruvius
TEXT.Chinese: "Building well has three conditions; firmness, commodity and delight." - Vitruvius

TEXT.English: "For forms of government let fools contest, whatever's best administered is best." - Alexander Pope
TEXT.Chinese: "For forms of government let fools contest, whatever's best administered is best." - Alexander Pope

TEXT.English: "True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing." - Socrates
TEXT.Chinese: "True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing." - Socrates

TEXT.English: "The wisest men follow their own direction." - Euripides
TEXT.Chinese: "The wisest men follow their own direction." - Euripides

TEXT.English: "Justice is a contract of expediency, entered upon to prevent men harming or being harmed." - Epicurus
TEXT.Chinese: "Justice is a contract of expediency, entered upon to prevent men harming or being harmed." - Epicurus

TEXT.English: "Such as do build up their faith upon the holy text of pike and gun...and decide all controversies by infalliable artillery." - Samuel Butler
TEXT.Chinese: "Such as do build up their faith upon the holy text of pike and gun...and decide all controversies by infalliable artillery." - Samuel Butler

TEXT.English: "No man shall be taken, imprisoned or destroyed, except by the lawful judgement of his peers." - The Magna Carta
TEXT.Chinese: "No man shall be taken, imprisoned or destroyed, except by the lawful judgement of his peers." - The Magna Carta

TEXT.English: "Kings arose before any estates or ranks of men, before any parliaments were holden, or laws made and by then all land was distributed which was at first wholely theirs. So it is that kings are the makers of law, not laws the makers of kings." - James I
TEXT.Chinese: "Kings arose before any estates or ranks of men, before any parliaments were holden, or laws made and by then all land was distributed which was at first wholely theirs. So it is that kings are the makers of law, not laws the makers of kings." - James I

TEXT.English: "All the world's a stage. And all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances. And each man, in his time, plays many parts." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Chinese: "All the world's a stage. And all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances. And each man, in his time, plays many parts." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: "The more opportunities there are in a Society for some persons to live upon the toil of others, the less those others may enjoy the fruits of their work themselves." - Anders Chydenius
TEXT.Chinese: "The more opportunities there are in a Society for some persons to live upon the toil of others, the less those others may enjoy the fruits of their work themselves." - Anders Chydenius

TEXT.English: "There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance." - Caliph Ali ibn Abi-Talib
TEXT.Chinese: "There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance." - Caliph Ali ibn Abi-Talib

TEXT.English: "A designer knows he has achieved perfection, not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." - Antoine de Saint-Expury
TEXT.Chinese: "A designer knows he has achieved perfection, not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." - Antoine de Saint-Expury

TEXT.English: "A desperate disease requires a dangerous remedy." - Guy Fawkes
TEXT.Chinese: "A desperate disease requires a dangerous remedy." - Guy Fawkes

TEXT.English: "For want of a nail the shoe is lost. For want of a shoe the horse is lost. For want of a horse the rider is lost." - George Herbert
TEXT.Chinese: "For want of a nail the shoe is lost. For want of a shoe the horse is lost. For want of a horse the rider is lost." - George Herbert

TEXT.English: "I will to my lord be true, and love all which he loves and shun all which he shuns."- Anglo-Saxon Oath of Fealty
TEXT.Chinese: "I will to my lord be true, and love all which he loves and shun all which he shuns."- Anglo-Saxon Oath of Fealty

TEXT.English: "Wise anger is like fire from a flint: there is great ado to get it out; and when it does come, it is out again immediately." - Matthew Henry
TEXT.Chinese: "Wise anger is like fire from a flint: there is great ado to get it out; and when it does come, it is out again immediately." - Matthew Henry

TEXT.English: "Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it." - Publius Syrus
TEXT.Chinese: "Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it." - Publius Syrus

TEXT.English: "I would call architecture frozen music." - Friedrich Schiller
TEXT.Chinese: "I would call architecture frozen music." - Friedrich Schiller

TEXT.English: "People of the same trade seldom meet together, even for merriment and diversion, but the conversation ends in a conspiracy against the public." - Adam Smith, "The Wealth of Nations"
TEXT.Chinese: "People of the same trade seldom meet together, even for merriment and diversion, but the conversation ends in a conspiracy against the public." - Adam Smith, "The Wealth of Nations"

TEXT.English: "Put your trust in God. And keep your powder dry". - Oliver Cromwell
TEXT.Chinese: "Put your trust in God. And keep your powder dry". - Oliver Cromwell

TEXT.English: "The Art of Medicine is to amuse the patient while Nature cures the disease." - Voltaire
TEXT.Chinese: "The Art of Medicine is to amuse the patient while Nature cures the disease." - Voltaire

TEXT.English: "There are only two ways of getting on in the world; By one's industry or by the stupidity of others." - Jean de La Bruyere
TEXT.Chinese: "There are only two ways of getting on in the world; By one's industry or by the stupidity of others." - Jean de La Bruyere

TEXT.English: "You can't direct the wind, but you can adjust your sails." - unknown
TEXT.Chinese: "You can't direct the wind, but you can adjust your sails." - unknown

TEXT.English: "Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security, will deserve neither and lose both." - Benjamin Franklin
TEXT.Chinese: "Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security, will deserve neither and lose both." - Benjamin Franklin

TEXT.English: "Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested." - Sir Francis Bacon
TEXT.Chinese: "Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested." - Sir Francis Bacon

TEXT.English: "Man is a tool-using animal. Without tools he is nothing. With tools he is all." - Thomas Carlyle
TEXT.Chinese: "Man is a tool-using animal. Without tools he is nothing. With tools he is all." - Thomas Carlyle

TEXT.English: "It is questionable if all the mechanical inventions yet made have lightened the days toil of any human being." - J.S. Mill
TEXT.Chinese: "It is questionable if all the mechanical inventions yet made have lightened the days toil of any human being." - J.S. Mill

TEXT.English: "They have shelter and ease in their fine manors. While we have hardship and toil and the rain in the fields. And from us must come from our labour, the things that keep them in luxury." - Jean Froissart
TEXT.Chinese: "They have shelter and ease in their fine manors. While we have hardship and toil and the rain in the fields. And from us must come from our labour, the things that keep them in luxury." - Jean Froissart

TEXT.English: "Like sea discoverers to new worlds have gone, like maps to other worlds have shown. Let us possess one World, each hath one and one for all." - John Donne
TEXT.Chinese: "Like sea discoverers to new worlds have gone, like maps to other worlds have shown. Let us possess one World, each hath one and one for all." - John Donne

TEXT.English: "As to diseases make a habit of two things - to help, or at least, to do no harm." - Hippocrates
TEXT.Chinese: "As to diseases make a habit of two things - to help, or at least, to do no harm." - Hippocrates

TEXT.English: "One minute decides the outcome of a battle, one hour the outcome of a campaign, and one day the fate of empires." - Alexander Suvorov
TEXT.Chinese: "One minute decides the outcome of a battle, one hour the outcome of a campaign, and one day the fate of empires." - Alexander Suvorov

TEXT.English: "Diplomacy without armies is like music without instruments." - Frederick the Great
TEXT.Chinese: "Diplomacy without armies is like music without instruments." - Frederick the Great

TEXT.English: "Meditation is the life of the soul, action is the soul of meditation, so meditate that you mayst give God glory." - Francis Quarles
TEXT.Chinese: "Meditation is the life of the soul, action is the soul of meditation, so meditate that you mayst give God glory." - Francis Quarles

TEXT.English: "The monuments of wit survive the monuments of power." - Francis Bacon
TEXT.Chinese: "The monuments of wit survive the monuments of power." - Francis Bacon

TEXT.English: "If music be the food of love, play on." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Chinese: "If music be the food of love, play on." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: "Such is the human condition, that to wish greatness for one's country is to wish harm to another's." - Voltaire
TEXT.Chinese: "Such is the human condition, that to wish greatness for one's country is to wish harm to another's." - Voltaire

TEXT.English: "The royal navy hath ever been its greatest defence and ornament. It is its ancient and natural strength, the floating bulwarks of our island." - William Blackstone
TEXT.Chinese: "The royal navy hath ever been its greatest defence and ornament. It is its ancient and natural strength, the floating bulwarks of our island." - William Blackstone

TEXT.English: "We should distinguish the properties of particulars, and gather by induction what pertains to the eye when vision takes place; And what is found in the manner of sensation to be uniform, unchanging, manifest and not subject to doubt." - Ibn al-Haytham
TEXT.Chinese: "We should distinguish the properties of particulars, and gather by induction what pertains to the eye when vision takes place; And what is found in the manner of sensation to be uniform, unchanging, manifest and not subject to doubt." - Ibn al-Haytham

TEXT.English: "You philosophers are lucky men. You write on paper. And paper is patient. But I am an Empress. And the people are not." - Catherine the Great
TEXT.Chinese: "You philosophers are lucky men. You write on paper. And paper is patient. But I am an Empress. And the people are not." - Catherine the Great

TEXT.English: "Patron (n.) One who countenances, supports or protects. Commonly a wretch who supports with insolence and is repaid with flattery." - Samuel Johnson
TEXT.Chinese: "Patron (n.) One who countenances, supports or protects. Commonly a wretch who supports with insolence and is repaid with flattery." - Samuel Johnson

TEXT.English: "I have gained this by philosophy, that I do without being commanded what others do only from the fear of the law." - Aristotle
TEXT.Chinese: "I have gained this by philosophy, that I do without being commanded what others do only from the fear of the law." - Aristotle

TEXT.English: "To every action there is always an opposed but equal reaction." - Isaac Newton
TEXT.Chinese: "To every action there is always an opposed but equal reaction." - Isaac Newton

TEXT.English: "You should hammer your iron when it is glowing hot." - Publius Syrus
TEXT.Chinese: "You should hammer your iron when it is glowing hot." - Publius Syrus

TEXT.English: "The house of everyone is to him his castle and fortress...as well for his defence against injury and violence as for his repose." - Edward Coke
TEXT.Chinese: "The house of everyone is to him his castle and fortress...as well for his defence against injury and violence as for his repose." - Edward Coke

TEXT.English: "Good order and discipline in an army are more to be depended upon than mere ferocity." - Nicolo Machiavelli
TEXT.Chinese: "Good order and discipline in an army are more to be depended upon than mere ferocity." - Nicolo Machiavelli

TEXT.English: "The city will gain beauty worthy of its name and to you it will be useful for its revenues and the eternal flame of its aggrandizement." - Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.Chinese: "The city will gain beauty worthy of its name and to you it will be useful for its revenues and the eternal flame of its aggrandizement." - Leonardo Da Vinci

TEXT.English: "The true work of Art is but a shadow of the Divine Perfection." - Michelangelo
TEXT.Chinese: "The true work of Art is but a shadow of the Divine Perfection." - Michelangelo

TEXT.English: "I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set him free." - Michelangelo
TEXT.Chinese: "I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set him free." - Michelangelo

TEXT.English: "True knowledge is greater than the sum of its parts." - Aristotle
TEXT.Chinese: "True knowledge is greater than the sum of its parts." - Aristotle

TEXT.English: "Man is born free but everywhere he is in chains." - Jean Jacques Rousseau
TEXT.Chinese: "Man is born free but everywhere he is in chains." - Jean Jacques Rousseau

TEXT.English: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who endowed us with sense, reason and intellect has intended us to forgoe its use." - Galileo Galilei
TEXT.Chinese: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who endowed us with sense, reason and intellect has intended us to forgoe its use." - Galileo Galilei

TEXT.English: "Is this the face that launched a thousand ships?" - Christopher Marlowe
TEXT.Chinese: "Is this the face that launched a thousand ships?" - Christopher Marlowe

TEXT.English: "And forty winters shall besiege thy brow, And dig deep trenches in the beauty's field. Against the wrackful siege of battering day. When rocks impregnable are not so stout." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Chinese: "And forty winters shall besiege thy brow, And dig deep trenches in the beauty's field. Against the wrackful siege of battering day. When rocks impregnable are not so stout." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: "Wit's an unruly engine, wildly striking sometimes a friend, sometimes the engineer." - George Herbert
TEXT.Chinese: "Wit's an unruly engine, wildly striking sometimes a friend, sometimes the engineer." - George Herbert

TEXT.English: "If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup." - Turkish proverb
TEXT.Chinese: "If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup." - Turkish proverb

TEXT.English: "Two cities have been formed by two loves, the earthly by love of self, the heavenly by the love of God." - St. Augustine
TEXT.Chinese: "Two cities have been formed by two loves, the earthly by love of self, the heavenly by the love of God." - St. Augustine

TEXT.English: "Our wants are various, and nobody has been found able to acquire even the necessaries without the aid of other peoples. And there is scarcely any Nation that has not stood in the need of others." - Anders Chydenius
TEXT.Chinese: "Our wants are various, and nobody has been found able to acquire even the necessaries without the aid of other peoples. And there is scarcely any Nation that has not stood in the need of others." - Anders Chydenius

TEXT.English: "As the King lives, so shall his vassals." - Old Portugese proverb
TEXT.Chinese: "As the King lives, so shall his vassals." - Old Portugese proverb

TEXT.English: "Heavens gates are not so highly arched as prince's palaces, that they enter there must go upon their knees." - John Webster
TEXT.Chinese: "Heavens gates are not so highly arched as prince's palaces, that they enter there must go upon their knees." - John Webster

TEXT.English: "He who first shortened the labour of copyists by device of moveable type was disbanding hired armies and creating a whole democratic world through the art of the printing machine." - Thomas Carlyle
TEXT.Chinese: "He who first shortened the labour of copyists by device of moveable type was disbanding hired armies and creating a whole democratic world through the art of the printing machine." - Thomas Carlyle
